subject: [Radiance-general] problems with the rayinit.cal
body:
Hugo,
At the risk of being too obvious: did you check the actual presence of the
file in the /lib directory? I recall having this issue as well on a windows
machine. Some distributions seem to miss this specific file.
regards, Casper

-----Original Message-----


To: radiance-general at radiance-online.org




Hello,
I have been reading all the posts concerning problems with the function file
"rayinit.cal"
So Accordingly to that I did some of the stuff i read. I went to the control
panel/advance/ environmental settings, and in the path and raypath i did the
changes needed in order for the system to find the rayinit file. Even though
i did all this when i run radiance from ecotect the same fatal error is
appearing: cannot find function file "rayinit.cal".


this is how i have it
path:
%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\hp\bin\Python;C:\Program
Files (x86)\Autodesk\Backburner\;C:\Program Files\Common Files\Autodesk
Shared\;C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Autodesk
Shared\;%SYSTEMROOT%\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\;C:\Radiance\lib

raypath:    .;C:\Radiance\lib

I cannot see which is the problem since I think the right direction is shown
in both path and raypath, what should I do? I have windows vista.


I apreciate any help I can have since I am doing my thesis and i want to set
illuminance values for several spaces in a project. Cheers
--
Ugo Testolini
a r q u i t e c t o
